nl.inl.blacklab.index

Class DocIndexerAbstract

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.inl.blacklab.index.DocIndexerAbstract
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DocIndexer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DocIndexerXml, DocIndexerXmlHandlers

    public abstract class DocIndexerAbstract
extends java.lang.Object
implements DocIndexer
    Abstract base class for a DocIndexer processing XML files.

      • getIndexer

        public Indexer getIndexer()
        Returns our Indexer object
        Returns:
        the Indexer object

      • setOmitNorms

        public void setOmitNorms(boolean b)
        Enables or disables norms. Norms are disabled by default. The method name was chosen to match Lucene's Field.setOmitNorms(). Norms are only required if you want to use document-length-normalized scoring.
        Parameters:
        b - if true, doesn't store norms; if false, does store norms

      • startCaptureContent

        @Deprecated
public void startCaptureContent()
        Deprecated. pass the field name you're capturing content for

      • getContentPositionNoStore

        @Deprecated
public int getContentPositionNoStore()
        Deprecated. will be handled differently in the future.
        Provided for compatibility with Meertens' fork of BlackLab; will eventually be removed in favor of an "official" way to index content without storing in a ContentStore. Not sure if this will always give the correct position because the original input is used for highlighting, not the reconstructed XML in the content variable.
        Returns:
        the content length
